div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1335 Caria, 1970 Burial: 150-100 B.C. Contents: c. 220 AR Caunus or Mylasa?: c. 200 dr. (as BMC Rhodes 210 ff.) Rhodes: 18 triob. (as BMC 291 ff.) Disposition: Chicago, Field Mus. of Nat. History, c. 200 Caunus or Mylasa Sheridan, ANSMN 18 (1972), pp. 5-15, illus. Thirty of the Chicago coins were seen in trade in London together with the Rhodian triob., all represented as coming from the same hd. The find- spot was given as Mylasa, but this was mere hearsay, perhaps influenced by the composition. Details on these coins are on file in BM and ANS
